headline: Crustless Spinach Quiche
description: This crustless quiche made with eggs, spinach, and Muenster cheese is quick and easy! Perfect to serve at any meal, it's ready in under an hour.

video.description: See how to make this quick-and-easy brunch classic.
video.name: Crustless Spinach Quiche

name: Crustless Spinach Quiche
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach - thawed, drained, and squeezed dry

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9-inch pie pan.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 3 minutes. Stir in spinach and continue to cook until excess moisture has evaporated.
Whisk together eggs, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add Muenster cheese and spinach mixture and stir until well blended.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs have set, about 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Tasty and easy! Looks beautiful coming out of the oven! I had to substitute fresh spinach for frozen (it was what I had) and also I used jack cheese instead of muenster - again what I had in my frig. I can see adding other vegies and other changes - it's just a good starting point for any thing in the frig!
One of my faves. I switch up the cheeses as well.
This recipe is amazing!! I added less spinach, mushrooms & roasted tomatoes. I love it!

make this 2 nights ago. I am not a very basic cook and do better following a recipe along with the suggested comments. So thank you all for your input! Made pretty much as the recipe calls for except I used 2 1/2 cups of the cheese and added 1/2 red bell pepper as someone else said in their comment. Baked for the 30 minutes, let it sit for 10 minutes and it was really good! Not dry, a little greasy from the cheese. Leftovers for bfast the next morning. Yum! Will make again with some bacon.
Easy, economical and fast. Love this!
Used a mix of New York White Cheddar and Parmesan cheeses. Added pan roasted mushrooms, shallots and a 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream. Will make this again!

Love this quiche. My mother-in-law makes the best quiche and I finally asked her for her recipe. Expecting some secret recipe that's been passed down for generations, it turns out that this was the recipe. I did have to keep it longer in the oven, twice as long or so, but it was great. I added some ham too for something extra.
Great recipe but FYI I believe a "crustless" quiche is a frittata. But this recipe is excellent üëç

I did not have Muenster cheese although I really love Muenster. I did have pepper jack cheese 8 oz. I grated that and put it in the place of the Muenster. It came out really well. I like Quiche with a crust better but this was a nice easy option for Quiche.

I LOVE this -- must have made it 25 times. It's very forgiving & versatile -- I always use 6 eggs & cook it a bit longer, & throw in some ham &/or cooked bacon. It's wonderful with chopped broccoli. My one argument with the recipe is the claim that it only takes 15 minutes to make. In what world??? Even if I use already shredded cheese, it takes me at least 40 minutes from start to in the oven. But it's worth it!!
So so good
This was so delicious and easy to make! A family favorite!

This is a fantastic recipe! I've made it many times now. It's one of those no fail recipes that comes out great every time. You can enjoy it as is or you can add more ingredients to your taste to jazz it up. Perfection. Thank you!
great foundation for crust-less quiche... 5 eggs and 3 cups of cheese! followed original recipe first time, then used whatever sounded good after that. No brainer breakfast!
Slight tweaks; added 1 egg, 1/2 cup half n half, 1 c diced cooked bacon, substituted mozzarella/parm reggiano for muenster & added a dash of nutmeg, baked in mini oven @ 325 for 35 minutes. Divine.
Easy to make, added fresh jalape√±os to spice it up. Used Mexican blend cheese and served warmed salsa on the side along with sour cream.

I love this and have used it as a bribe to get a coworker to pick up an extra shift with me ( her idea on what I brought)‚Ä¶lol. I like to add garlic and some bacon bits to mine. Everyone who has tried it ask for the recipe.

This is my go to crustless quiche recipe. Happy with it every time! I make a few tweaks - Sautee just over 1 lb fresh spinach sauteed in onion and garlic, in place of frozen spinach Add 1 portabella mushroom sliced to cooked spinach while mixing up egg mixture Reduce shredded cheese to two cups, top with feta crumbles when it comes out of the oven to rest for 10 minutes
Making changes to my diet and this was very good. Made adjustments, had some random cheeses and went with Cajun spices
It was great! Made exactly as the recipe.

The kind of recipe I love. No French chefs please. Adaptable and easy. Yayyy!!!!!! My first quiche is in the oven and I can't wait. I know it will work. Tomatoes mushrooms broccoli and bacon. Like The girls used to make. Jerry from Bacholar paradise Thank you!!!
I used half a bag of 8oz Mexican cheese. What i had on hand. Looks flat coming out. My first try.
I had 6 eggs instead of 5. Super simply to make, the young kids can make it

I make this crustless quiche every year for my Passover Seder, and it is always everyone's second favorite dish (I make some bomb matzoh balls)! It's so easy to prepare, can be made ahead, reheats nicely, stays warm easily. The only thing difficult is finding Muenster cheese in a block rather than in slices. But this year I found exactly what I needed at Smart n Final. This recipe works beautifully with any green vegetable, so if you lack spinach, try leftover green beans, artichoke hearts, asparagus or broccoli and feel free to substitute caramelized leeks or shallots for the onions. Madgeypoo

This was so yummy! I used about half a can of spinach as I didn't have frozen. I also used a mix of cheeses that I had on hand and cut it to 2 cups. I added a pinch of nutmeg as well. I love that you can really customize this to whomever is eating it. It's my new fave Keto breakfast!
This recipe was so good. I always snake it for book club breakfasts and whenever I have company in town. Everyone loves it. Very tasty & easy to make.
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
The recipe was easy to make, but it definitely needed more seasoning. Really bland I added garlic salt and white pepper to flavor it up!

Added an orange pepper, went without the onion because I didn't have one, added 2 eggs, and used mild cheddar cheese instead of muenster because I didn't have any muenster (and also only 1.5 cups of it). Turned out very good.
I made this for Christmas morning adding a chopped up red bell pepper to it. It was a hit!

This has become my favorite go to recipe and only the first time I made it!
Super easy... Only had three eggs and it was only for me, so I cut the recipe in half for 3 servings. I did a mix of vegetables using microwaved mushrooms ,spinach , diced up colorful mini peppers and onion, a cup.
Used my toaster oven and a small Pyrex dish baked it for 20 minutes at 350¬∞... Came out wonderfully, delicious!!
Great tasting and easy to make. I added 2 cooked crumbled pieces of bacon!!

Absolutely fabulous! I read all the reviews saying how "forgiving" this recipe is, so I decided to go right to town! As someone else suggested, I doubled the recipe and poured it into a 9 x 13 pan. I only used 4 cups of cheese in the doubled recipe--that was plenty. And I used 5 eggs and 7 egg whites to lower the calorie count. I used fresh spinach, cheddar cheese and some leftover mushrooms. I also took another's suggestion about sprinkling a bit of Parmesan on top before baking.

My only problem with this recipe is keeping the finished product around. Everyone gobbles it up! Bottom line is if you follow the basic recipe here, you can make a LOT of switches (type of cheese, veggies used, etc.) each time you make it.
Easy, healthy and delicious. I added ham and a yellow pepper. Did not add any salt.
Loved it. Added red capsicum and cherry tomatoes. Used single cream instead of double cream. Perfect recipe.

This was exactly what I needed to use up some fresh spinach & eggs I had. The recipe was easy & went exactly as described. 
It is a forgiving recipe; I used sweet onions, 2 garlic cloves & 6 eggs. I boiled the spinach for 30 seconds, placed in a water bath & squeezed the water out. Even though it was a bit wetter than frozen spinach, I let it stay in the pan until the extra moisture left.
I would definitely make this again, & maybe add some Parmesan.
very easy to follow recipe. I've made it several times now with different cheeses. Each is unique and quick.

So easy. Love that it is low carb. Made double with some additional vegetables (zucchini, mushrooms, red peppers). Used 16 oz package of frozen spinach and instead of 6 cups of cheese, I used 3 1/2. Added some extra seasonings (extra garlic, herbs, fresh basil). Came out delicious! The recipe is very forgiving. Feel free to improvise. SUPER! Enjoy.

Wonderful recipe only instead of mixing everything together with the eggs I put them in layers for the layer effect as well as how I learned in France when little. Veggies mixed and on bottom or on crust (I made a cauliflower crust) then egg on top then cheese on top after it has baked‚Ä¶ if using bacon, fry it up crispy and layer on bottom of crust then veggies then egg then cheese at end and design with whatever you like if you want. Fabulous quiche!
Awesome!
Loved this recipe. I used whatever cheese I had in the refrigerator and it worked out great. I did the muffins and froze most of them. They thaw out perfectly.
At first I was suspicious there was too much onion, but the end result was just right

I had fresh spinach I had to use. Found this recipe. Easy. I only used 2 cups of cheddar cheese as someone suggested. I used 5 oz. fresh spinach and 2 shallots (didn't want to use my last onion). Baked it in my toaster oven in a 6x8 glass dish. Perfect for cutting into portions for a quick and easy breakfast. Will definitely make this again.
Great and quick for brunch!
My family really liked this. Didn‚Äôt make any adjustments to recipe. I would double the recipe to feed more than four people as a min meal.
Simple to make. Rich and tasty to eat. Definitely a recipe worth repeating!!
I put my own spin on this. I added red onion, swiss cheese, leftover corned beef, mushrooms. so delicious!

It was nice and easy. My package of spinach was 12 oz so I used 6 eggs. Also used what ever cheese I had so it end d up as a combination of Parmesan, provolone and something else that I don‚Äôt recall. I also added a touch of nutmeg to the spinach as it was saut√©ing. Thanks for the recipe!

Elevated by MUENSTER CHEESE! I didn't have enough shredded, to added mozzarella, also added mushrooms and fresh finely processed spinach. Hubby loved it! I think next time I might add a little bit of heat.
This was SO good!!! I added a touch of Cajun spice because I love it. Everyone enjoyed it - huge hit!

I think I followed the recipe exactly the first time and quite enjoyed it. Now I make it about once a week and mix it up a bit. I use additional frozen vegetables sometimes, depending on what's in the freezer. So far I've always included some spinach but sometimes reduce the spinach a bit and add in broccoli or brussel sprouts (no doubt other things will work their way in depending on what's in the fridge/freezer). I mostly thaw the other vegetables, then chop them up fairly small so there are not big chunks and add them to the frying pan after the onion's cooked a bit but before adding the spinach, to soften up a bit. I usually use old cheddar as we usually have that in the house and it's cheaper than Muenster, although the Muenster is delicious too. I also realized I've been using about 2 cups rather than 3 of cheese for the last while. It seems to be plenty (and I love cheese). This recipe is a good way to get me to eat and enjoy green vegetables, which are not my favourite by themselves, and it's been really handy to have in the fridge for a quick bite when we're in a rush. I like that we have all the ingredients on hand and can throw it together quickly and easily at a moment's notice.
GREAT!!! Added sun dried tomatoes and replaced 1 cup of cheese with hot pepper cheese. Will become a staple in our house!
It was delicious. I used fresh spinach, the only change
This was a very good recipe. I did make a couple of changes. I used fresh spinach instead of frozen, Swiss cheese instead of Muenster cheese, and I added mushrooms. I will definitely make this again.
Turned out delicious !

The first time I made this, I followed the recipe exactly. Now I add mushrooms, a tomato, garlic, etc... 
This is such an easy healthy recipe. I love it and I make it regularly.
No changes necessary. This recipe was amazing! And so easy even a novice cook could impress guests.

Even though this is so simple, it is quite delicious. I didn't have Muenster cheese so I used Mozzarella instead and it was great. Looking forward to using Muenster the next time. Will probably add some cooked bacon next time also, but honestly it doesn't need anything extra. Love the fact that it is crustless. We don't need the extra calories and carbs from a crust.
This is an absolute 'No Fail' recipe...it's perfect every time!!

Such a lovely recipe. I did put my small spin on it though. When frying the onions I added red pepper flakes sage and minced garlic. I decreased the cheese and upped the eggs by 2. Made it in a 9 inch pan! Delicious!
This is an excellent dish, but the cheese is quite expensive. I am wondering if there is a less expensive alternative, because this is very tasty and healthy.
Made this for dinner tonight and it turned out great. I switched Muenster for cheddar because that‚Äôs what I had and added a little diced ham leftover from Christmas. Wife asked me to make it again!
We used whatever cheese we have at the time and also mix cheeses

My family, my neighbors and I LOVE this recipe. I use fresh spinach, and sometimes add some mushrooms. I also use assorted shredded cheeses, and that adds a bit of pizazz to the flavor. GREAT for us gluten-free types!!!

My husband and I truly enjoyed this recipe! I switched it up a bit. I added cubed sweet ham and Baby Bella mushrooms & deleted the onions. I used 1 Cup of a shredded mozzarella and 2 Cups of shredded Muenster cheese. It was delicious!
It was excellent. I used six eggs.
the easiest recipe. I added crunchy onions on top. sooo good!!
Wonderful recipe.
Substituted ingredients I had available, fresh spinach, cheddar, Swiss, Feta, and Cotija cheeses. Served with salad. Easy, fast and delicious dinner.
This has become a reliable favorite for guests or for family. Always comes out perfect
Outstanding dish, easy any delicious. I did add some chicken breast I had bake the night before and pepper-jack cheese.
Great recipe. Why do people feel compelled to post their own recipe as a ‚Äúreview‚Äù? Please just SUBMIT YOUR OWN RECIPE!

I‚Äôve made this using cheese I had on hand mixing reduced fat cheddar, Parmesan, and part skim mozzarella. I have also added more eggs and substituted fresh cooked spinach.It always comes out delicious with a good consistency.

A very simple quiche, but the Muenster cheese gives it great flavor. I prefer quiche with crust so I used a premade frozen crust. I also whisked a little cream into the eggs because I always use cream in my quiche. Delicious.
So simple and always a crowd pleaser. I have made this twice for brunches and everyone is always impressed.
I did add a small can of sliced black olives to it.
EASY PEASY ~AND FEEDS MORE THAN ONE!!(or ONCE!)

Started Keto diet and LOVE this recipe, but did not have the muenster cheese so used about 1.5 cups of Trader Joe's shredded soy cheese blend and added some sliced fresh portobello mushroom and fresh dill.

Great recipe! Easy, too! I followed it but had to mix mozzarella, Muenster, and cheddar cheeses to get two cups. It was still very good! Next time I will try all sharp cheddar and green onion instead of white. I made 12 muffins and froze the leftovers. I figured that nuking for about 45 seconds should give me a quick and tasty treat! Thanks!

I have now made this recipe dozens of times. Everyone loves it and it is very easy. I do modify it, reducing the cheese to 5 oz. for reduced saturated fat. It's still plenty cheesy and limits the cheese to 1 oz. per serving.
This is the best Quiche ever!! I have made it with different types of meat and added different vegetables no matter what you use in it, it so good!
I caramelized red onions but otherwise followed the recipe. Tasty.
Added extra egg for10oz.bag of fresh spinach. Paprika, garlic powder, garlic pepper, sage. Sprinkle paprika on top. 2 6oz. bags of parmesan cheese.
Was is very good and easy to make. I even added chicken
Used feta cheese instead because that‚Äôs all I had.

This is great as written. Also an excellent base recipe-- it's a "things that need to be used up" recipe, and I have added different veggies, cooked rice or potatoes, goat cheese, etc and it's always good, always different and ready for a quick workday breakfast.

Crustless is the only way to go when leftovers have to be refrigerated. With no crust, just reheat the dish and it is as fresh as when first made. No wet, doughy crust or bottom. Flavors were mild and enjoyable to my palate but can certainly be spiked up with peppers, etc.
Yes I made it. Enjoying my Sunday in this Pandemic times. Y‚Äôall try it‚Äôs tasty

I love making quiche because I change it up a little every time. This time I used less spinach but added 1/4 of a sliced raw zucchini to the pan with the onions. Added 1/4 cup of leftover cooked cauliflower rice to the egg/cheese mixture. I also used 1/4 cup of feta, 1/4 cup of grated Parmesan and 1/4 cup of a mixed shredded cheese. (less cheese over all but that‚Äôs all I had) did not add any salt as the salt from the cheese will make up for it. You really can‚Äôt go wrong adding whatever veggies and/or meat you like! Be creative!

I made this one as is, but cooked it in a muffin pan, and it turned out just perfect. Like others, I added nutmeg to the mixture, and for me that always adds a lot. It's a really easy and wonderful recipe.
Made it with cheddar (it‚Äôs what we had) and fresh spinach (same). Super good.

The only change I make is to use shredded cheddar instead of munster as I can never find shredded munster. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs great for a luncheon but it‚Äôs enough for myself and my husband for dinner with a big slice leftover! Really good, we both love it (and it‚Äôs so simple to make)!
simple and delicious!

Never had a quiche before, so I thought I'd try this. It turned out pretty good! I added more spinach then called for and a little more cheese- basically tasted like spinach and cheese held together with little egg... I thought it was super tasty!

This is a very versatile recipe. You can add cubed ham and bacon bits ( for breakfast/brunch ) or if for dinner, cubed cooked chicken and fresh chopped rosemary. I substituted Mozzarella cheese for the Muenster cheese. Excellent recipe and saves well in the fridge for next day or so. Thx for sharing!

I fall back on this recipe often; it is so versatile and you can change it up any way you want, for any meal of the day! It is even good cold (provided you have any leftovers!!) I generally use 2 packages of spinach, or sometimes chopped frozen kale or a mixture of the two. I let the onions brown just a little before adding the greens; if you squeeze the greens out well in a colander, they don't retain much water to cook away. Although it's one of my husband's favorites, muenster cheese always seems a bit bland to me, so I have used all different types of cheese. But, I do want spinach to be the star and some cheeses overpower it, so I've settled on 1/2 swiss and 1/2 fontina as my favorite. Also, I add some freshly grated nutmeg to the spinach/cheese/egg mixture because nutmeg and spinach seem made for each other. Try the finished product with a little salsa on top--yum!! I am very grateful to ANY14TNS for giving us such a great basic recipe--happy eating!!
oh YUM!! My husband and I eat the WHOLE pie because it was soooooooooooo GOOD!! We will be having it again soon! By the way, it was easy and quick to make!!!
Love, love, love this recipe.

This has become part of my regular rotation for dinner. Last night I had some mushrooms that needed to be used, so I chopped and added them to the saute. I don't believe I've ever had muenster on hand, but any kind of cheese will work. Last night was a cheddar/jack combo. So delicious -- thanks for sharing!
